activity.name: Furniture industry activities
activity.description: Processes of the product life cycle related to furniture industry.

activity.name: Sell products
activity.description: Supply manufacturered products to an end user, as specified in an order prepared by a retailer according to the product specifications described by the manufacturer's catalogue (A0).

activity.name: Create furnishing project
activity.description: Specify the essential elements and properties of a furnishing project in the form of lists of essential characteristics such as dimension, space distribution, etc... (A2).

activity.name: Process the order
activity.description: The manufacturer assesses the order according to commercial and technical criteria. If the order is rejected then the customer is informed of the reasons for rejection. If the order is accepted then the order information is passed to the production department and the customer is notified of the order acceptance (A4).

icom.name: Design products
icom.description: Define the requirements for new products taking into account factors including market situation, existing products, applicable standards, manufacturing and assembly requirements, and recyclability. Commercial and creative departments are involved; external designers may also be contracted to contribute to the design process (A-01).

icom.name: Develop products
icom.description: Produce detailed technical designs for products in form of CAD models, technical drawings, and other documents. Sometimes prototypes are required for production. Once the design is approved the price lists are prepared. There is collaboration between the technical and manufacturing departments in this phase (A-02).

icom.name: Manufacture products
icom.description: Produce furniture items from raw materials in order to obtain the final product to meet defined quality requirements. This activity consists of production programming, process planning and product manufacturing. Technical drawings are the information generated during design and development. Manufacturing resources are human resources (such as CNC operator and programmer) and physical resources (such CNC machinery, CAD/CAE systems, and tools) necessary for product manufacturing (A-03).

icom.name: Ship price list and catalogue
icom.description: Send the current product catalogue and associated prices. This activity ships the fees and catalogues to the Shops following the internal manufacturer's policy. Nowadays it is carried out by mail, in diskette or CD but it is intended to get the information in the future from the www through Internet services (A1).

icom.name: Compile and send the order
icom.description: Prepare and deliver the specifications required by a manufacturer to fulfil the requirements of a retailer or end user for a decoration project. These specifications include the decoration project design, the retailer's commercial data, requested delivery date, and terms of payment. This activity is undertaken by the retailer's commercial department when the retailer's offer is accepted by the end user (A3).

icom.name: Deliver products
icom.description: Transfer manufactured products from the manufacturer to the retailer, according to the manufacturing planning instructions (A5).

icom.name: Define space for furnishing project
icom.description: Specify the space dimensions for a furnishing project (A21).

icom.name: Select CAD library
Position objects for composition
Prepare offer for end user
icom.description: Generate the costs associated with the items specified for the decoration project. The costs can be consulted at any time during the project design. Modifications can be carried out based on design or budgetary constraints (A24).

icom.name: Compile order information
icom.description: Compile order information: Apply the manufacturer's order filter policy to select the processable orders (A41).

icom.name: Verify retailer's credit
icom.description: Each manufacturer has a customer data base with the relevant data from each retailer, updating periodically their data (A42).

icom.name: Verify technical data
icom.description: All the data are checked once the technical information is isolated, first of all the completeness of data and possible coding errors, later, the technical feasibility (A43).

icom.name: Process rejected order
icom.description: When a project has technical or credit irregularities is sent to this activity (A44).

icom.name: Calculate special case
icom.description: Determine the budget and delivery date for special products that are included in a decoration project, so that the retailer can calculate the final project budget (A45).

icom.name: Process accepted order
icom.description: Analyze an order and derive the information necessary to initiate the necessary processes such as production, logistics, and planning (A46).

icom.name: accepted offer
icom.description: Specification of the budget for a decoration project that has been reviewed and accepted by the end user (output from A2/A24, input to A3).

icom.name: CAD deco system
icom.description: A computer aided design system used by a retailer or by a manufacturer to design decoration projects (mechanism for A2/A21, A22, and A23).

icom.name: CAD library
icom.description: Selection of furniture items according to manufacturer, product line, and style. The CAD library items are available to use in a decoration project (output from A22, input to A23).

icom.name: CAD system
icom.description: Computer hardware and software that supports the computer aided design of products by providing functions for defining the geometry (2D or 3D) and technological properties (mechanism for A-02).

icom.name: CAD system
icom.description: Computer hardware and software that supports the computer aided design of products by providing functions for defining the geometry (2D or 3D) and technological properties (mechanism for A43, and A45).

icom.name: cancellation
icom.description: Rejection of an order (input to A46).

icom.name: commercial department
icom.description: Personnel responsible of the distribution of commercial information and for filtering and compiling order information (control on A-01).

icom.name: company objectives
icom.description: The set of achievements foreseen by a company. These objectives will affect directly technical and commercial policies to be applied to the design process (control on A-01).

icom.name: creative department
icom.description: Personnel responsible of the development of new ideas for bringing the new product to market (mechanism for A-01).

icom.name: credit acceptance
icom.description: Confirmation of the retailer's financial status, including credit rating and payment history (output from A42, control on A43).

icom.name: delivered products
icom.description: Products shipped to the retailer (output from A5).

icom.name: delivery date
icom.description: Date when the products required for a decoration project are to be shipped to the retailer (output from A41, input to A43).

icom.name: design information
icom.description: Functionality, geometry, and technological properties (output from A-01, input to A-02).

icom.name: designer
icom.description: Person in charge of defining the design information of a product (mechanism for A-01).

icom.name: end user data
icom.description: Information about who sends the order to buy a product (input for A0).

icom.name: end user requirements
icom.description: Information supplied by the end user indicating the desired functional and physical characteristics of the items to be included in a decoration project, including the style, materials, and colours (input to A2/A21, and A22).

icom.name: furnishing constraints
icom.description: The rules imposed by a manufacturer and controlled by a CAD-deco systems influence or determine the selection of items for a decoration project (control on A2/A21, A22, andA23). EXAMPLE Furnishing constraints can include location rules, joining rules among pieces, limits on combinations of styles, colours, and finishes, and price list rules.

icom.name: furnishing project design
icom.description: Information that defines the products needed for a furnishing project in the context of the space(s) they will be placed in. This information can include different views of the furnished space(s), such as plan, elevation, and perspective drawings (output from A2/A23).

icom.name: furnishing project cost
icom.description: Budget proposed to the end user (output from A23, input to A24).

icom.name: internal information
icom.description: Data which is related to and is useful only for a company (input to A-01).

icom.name: manufactured products
icom.description: Products ready for shipping following the order indications and data (output from A-03, input to A0/A5).

icom.name: manufactured products
icom.description: Products ready for shipping following the order indications and data (output from A-03, input to A0/A5).

icom.name: manufacturer's selling policy
icom.description: Rules for delivering information to different retailers based on geographic and/or commercial relationships (control on A0/A1).

icom.name: manufacturer's commercial department
icom.description: Personnel responsible of the distribution of commercial information to the manufacturer's clients and for filtering and compiling order information (mechanism for A0/A1, and A5).

icom.name: manufacturer's commercial department
icom.description: Personnel responsible for filtering and processing orders from retailers (mechanism for A0/A1, and A5).

icom.name: manufacturer's internal computer system (mechanism for A41, and A42).
icom.description: General software for administration and production management.

icom.name: manufacturer's notification
icom.description: An acceptance or rejection notification send by a manufacturer to a retailer. The notification will be positive (acceptance) if all technical and commercial constraints and requirements are satisfied (output from A4/A44, and A46, control on A3).

icom.name: manufacturer's notification
icom.description: An acceptance or rejection notification send by a manufacturer to a retailer. The notification will be positive (acceptance) if all technical and commercial constraints and requirements are satisfied (output from A4/A44, and A46, control on A3).

icom.name: manufacturer's rules
icom.description: Rules defined for special products, such as increments over the normal price that apply to manufacturing modifications to standard designs (control on A45).

icom.name: manufacturer's technical department
icom.description: Personnel responsible for technical verification of orders and for analysis and response to requirements for special or non-standard products (mechanism for A4/A43, and A45).

icom.name: manufacturer's technical department
icom.description: Personnel responsible for technical verification of orders and for analysis and response to requirements for special or non-standard products (mechanism for A4/A43, and A45).

icom.name: manufacturers' samples
icom.description: Examples of different manufacturers' products used by the retailer to show end users the characteristics of different products, such as their materials, colour, finish, and quality (mechanism for A2/A22).

icom.name: manufacturing constraints
icom.description: The imposed rules which influence or determine the development of products (control on A-02).

icom.name: manufacturing orders
icom.description: Requests of manufacturing a product after being designed and developed (output from A-02, input to A-03).

icom.name: manufacturing planning
icom.description: The set of instructions that apply to the manufacturing process, including distribution routes, controls and transport indications (output from A-02, control on A-03, and A0/A5).

icom.name: manufacturing requested changes
icom.description: Modifications which are needed in order to manufacture the product (output from A-02, control on A-01).

icom.name: manufacturing resources
icom.description: Provision of the available material and human resources which are necessary for producing the product (mechanism for A-03).

icom.name: market survey
icom.description: Research process whose objective is to find out what the market demands or how it will react from certain products (input to A-01).

icom.name: order filter policy
icom.description: The set of technical and commercial filters that are applied to an order before the rejection or acceptance process. These specify the restrictions and controls that determine whether an order is accepted into the manufacturer's systems (control on A0/A4/A41, A42, and A44).

icom.name: order information to production
icom.description: Notification that specifies the products to be produced, packaged and shipped in response to an order, and initiates the production process for those products (output from A0/A4/A46, control on A-03, control on A5).

icom.name: order
icom.description: Specification of a number of furniture items to be produced and delivered to a retailer or end user. The order is prepared by the retailer with the help of the CAD-deco system to obtain the budget and the views needed for the particular project. NOTE 1 Orders are conventionally sent by letter or fax from the retailer to the manufacturer; increasingly email and other forms of e-commerce are being used. NOTE 2 An order consists of three basic parts: retailer's data such as name and address; the decoration project design, consisting of the documents needed to describe the project completely; identification of the items Article description; quantity, code, description, price, etc. When the project contains special products (products that are not catalogued products) the order may also include sketches indicating dimensions, notes, etc. (output from A3, input to A4/A41).

icom.name: planning system
icom.description: Software tool used to automate the production planning process including the creation of process plans and the determination of manufacturing sequences (mechanism for A44, and A46).

icom.name: price list
icom.description: A list of the prices of a determined number of products (output from A-02, input to A0/A1).

icom.name: price list and catalogue rules
icom.description: The constraints imposed by a manufacturer and controlled by a CAD-deco system that influence or determine the selection of items for a decoration project based on price (control on A24).

icom.name: price list and catalogue
icom.description: Description of the furniture items that can be supplied by a manufacturer together with prices and other information necessary for ordering, including name, code, dimensions, drawings, and photographs (output from A1, control on A2/A22).

icom.name: product catalogue
icom.description: A document that identifies the products that a manufacturer can make including the available options and possible combinations. The product catalogue consists of textual and graphical descriptions of the manufacturer's products (including sketches, diagrams, and photographs) and can be published on paper or in electronic form (output from A-01, input A0/A1).

icom.name: product requeriments
icom.description: Restrictions which should be taken into account in order to produce a product (input to A-01).

icom.name: prototypes
icom.description: The models or patterns from which subsequent copies are made, or improved specimens are developed (output from A-03, input to A-02).

icom.name: quality control
icom.description: Mechanism which evaluate and optimize the quality or reliability of a product or process (control on A-03).

icom.name: raw material
icom.description: Crude unprocessed or partially processed material used as a feedstock for a processing operation (input to A-03).

icom.name: rejected order form
icom.description: A document sent by a manufacturer to a retailer specifying the reasons for the rejection of an order (output from A42, input to A44).

icom.name: rejected technical project
icom.description: A project that can not be produced for technical reasons (output from A43, input to A44).

icom.name: requested delivery date
icom.description: The preferred date, specified by a retailer, on which goods are to be delivered to an end user (input to A0/A3).

icom.name: requested terms of payment
icom.description: The preferred commercial conditions, specified by the retailer, for the purchase of goods from a manufacturer (input to A0/A3).

icom.name: retailer data
icom.description: The name and address of the retailer together with other information including company and government identifiers (input to A0/A1).

icom.name: retailer's data
icom.description: The name and address of the retailer together with other information including company and government identifiers (output from A41, input to A42).

icom.name: retailer's commercial department
icom.description: Personnel responsible for determining an end user's requirements, creating a decoration project definition meeting those requirements, preparing an offer to the end user, and compiling and sending an order to a manufacturer (mechanism for A0/A3, and A2/A21, A23, and A24).

icom.name: sketches for space definition
icom.description: It can be in several ways; technical drawings of the room to furnish, hand made sketches or oral information from the buyer (input to A2/A21).

icom.name: space and materials
icom.description: When the end user information space is defined (shape and measures) introducing real dimensions, identifying walls, doors, windows and accidents and defining material qualities for floor, ceiling, doors, etc (output from A21, input to A23).

icom.name: special case conditions acceptance
icom.description: When a project has 'special' products, out of catalogue; with cuts, horizontal, vertical, -both longer or shorter than usual-, with a different shape, etc., the budget is calculated based on manufacturer's rules and most cases the budget is produced by the commercial manufacturer's department. Then this acceptance notification is sent to the manufacturer (output from A3, input to A4/A45).

icom.name: special case conditions
icom.description: Budget and delivery date for the special project are sent back to the Retailer waiting for acceptance (output from A4/A45, control on A46, and A3).

icom.name: special case conditions
icom.description: Special budget for special products including delivery date (output from A4/A45, control on A46, and A3).

icom.name: special products
icom.description: In case the project has special products is needed to be sent to the calculate special case activity with the information concerning with the special items (output from A43, input to A45, and A46).

icom.name: standard products
icom.description: When the project consists of standard product, from the catalogue a completeness and feasibility check is carried out and if the result is positive it is sent to the process accepted order activity, in other case it is sent to the process rejected order activity (output from A43, input to A46).

icom.name: standards
icom.description: Rules applicable to the furniture industry as a whole, or to a specific furniture company in order to ensure commonality between products and tools. These rules can be international standards (e.g., ISO, IEC), national standards (e.g., AFNOR, ANSI, DIN), or company policies (control on A-01, and A-02).

icom.name: technical data
icom.description: Information for the project to be develop, drawings, material indications, sketches, etc (output from A41, input to A43).

icom.name: technical drawings
icom.description: Descriptive pictures which are necessary to manufacture a product (output from A-02, input to A-03).

icom.name: technical office
icom.description: Personnel responsible of the development of the technical drawings (mechanism for A-02).

icom.name: transport resources
icom.description: Vehicles available in the company for expedition and transport of the products to Retailers (mechanism for A5).
